title: EU Says Lack of US Clarity on Tariffs Sank Trade Announcement
description: A refusal by the US to clarify when it would remove punitive trade measures against the European Union is a key reason the transatlantic allies failed to reach an accord on steel trade this week that would have resolved a Trump-era dispute, according to the bloc’s chief trade negotiator.

title: Biden Says Hamas Attacked to Halt Israel-Saudi Normalization
description: US President Joe Biden said Hamas attacked Israel in part to stymie the Jewish state’s efforts to normalize relations with Saudi Arabia, his most illuminating comments yet on the impetus for the crisis in the Middle East.

title: Fatal Attack in Brussels Prompts Resignation of Justice Minister
description: Belgian Justice Minister Vincent Van Quickenborne resigned after a Tunisian shot and killed two football fans in Brussels, saying a judicial lapse that allowed the man to stay in the country was an “unforgivable” error.

title: Republicans’ House Speaker Drama Drags Into Another Week
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional reporter Steven T. Dennis looks at what’s ahead for House Republicans. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: US Supreme Court Allows White House Social Media Contacts for Now
description: The US Supreme Court let Biden administration officials communicate freely with social media companies while the justices review a case that centers on the federal government’s efforts to combat online misinformation about Covid-19.

title: US Supreme Court Leaves Missouri Gun-Rights Law on Hold for Now
description: The US Supreme Court refused to resurrect a Missouri law that would nullify a number of federal gun laws and regulations.

title: A New Field of Would-Be US House Speakers Takes Shape After Jim Jordan Fails
description: House Republicans have dispensed with Jim Jordan as their nominee for the US speakership and now several more are preparing to enter the fray.

title: Why Pro-Dollar Politician Javier Milei Is Roiling Argentina Markets
description: Javier Milei, a free-marketeer and political outsider, has been leading the race for Argentina’s Oct. 22 presidential election since pulling off a stunning victory in the August primary. Here’s what you need to know about Milei — and why the election matters for the rest of the world.

title: EU Is Preparing to Start Work on a New Russia Sanctions Package
description: The European Union will start consulting with member states in the coming days on a new sanctions package targeting Russia for its war against Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Russia Works to Undermine Voter Confidence Worldwide, US Says
description: Russia is working globally to undermine public confidence in the integrity of democratic elections, expanding tactics it used in the 2020 American contest for the presidency, according to US intelligence agencies.

title: Trump Loyalist Jim Jordan Loses Republican House Speaker Nomination
description: Trump loyalist Jim Jordan lost the Republican nomination for US House speaker Friday after a secret ballot of GOP lawmakers.

title: US Pressing Israel to Delay Gaza Invasion to Win Hostage Release
description: US and European governments have been putting pressure on Israel to delay its ground invasion of Gaza to buy time for secret talks underway via Qatar to win the release of hostages held by Hamas, according to people familiar with the efforts.

title: Hamas Says It Freed American Mother and Daughter Held Hostage
description: Hamas said it released an American mother and her daughter nearly two weeks after it seized more than 200 people in an attack on Israel that killed 1,400 people.

title: AMLO Hits Back at Vulcan, Threatens to Use Environmental Decree
description: Mexico’s president threatened to declare a disputed property owned by Vulcan Materials Co. an environmentally protected area, after failing to reach an agreement with the US construction firm.

title: Trump Lawyer Chesebro Pleads Guilty in Georgia Election Case
description: Kenneth Chesebro, an attorney accused of playing a critical behind-the-scenes role in Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election, has pleaded guilty in the criminal case in Fulton County, Georgia, against the former president and members of his inner circle.

title: US Senators Arrive in Saudi Arabia While Fears of Wider War Grow
description: A bipartisan group of US senators arrived in Saudi Arabia as part of a trip through the region aimed at keeping Saudi-Israeli diplomacy on track and trying to prevent Israel’s conflict with Hamas from spreading into a wider war.

title: Mexico’s Lawmakers Vote to Give Pemex an Even Bigger Tax Relief
description: Mexico’s lower house of Congress voted to give Petroleos Mexicanos an even bigger tax reduction than that proposed by the government in the 2024 budget, potentially providing more relief to the indebted state-owned oil company.

title: Mexico and China Seek to Stem Fentanyl’s Deadly Cross-Pacific Flow
description: Mexico is in talks with China to stem the flow of fentanyl ingredients as the US pressures source countries to curb the opioid epidemic.

title: Biden Requests $106 Billion for Israel, Ukraine, Border
description: President Joe Biden unveiled a nearly $106 billion request for emergency funds to arm Israel and Ukraine and to reinforce the US-Mexico border, in hopes that a comprehensive package could help speed passage through the fractured political climate on Capitol Hill.

title: Israel’s Defense Minister Gives More Details on Plans for Gaza
description: Israel’s defense minister gave more details about the country’s military plans for Gaza on Friday, implying it has no intention of running the territory after its operations wind down.

title: HSBC’s Sale of Canada Unit to RBC Is Opposed by Conservative Leader
description: The leader of Canada’s main opposition political party says the government should block HSBC Holdings Plc’s sale of its local operations to Royal Bank of Canada.

title: Zimbabwe Calls By-Elections After Opposition Lawmakers Lose Seats
description: Zimbabwean President Emmerson Mnangagwa declared by-elections in nine constituencies that were controlled by lawmakers from the main opposition party who were stripped of their parliamentary seats.

title: Who are Yemen’s Houthis? Can They Strike Israel?
description: As the Israel-Hamas war escalates, there’s growing concern that the conflict will spread across the region, drawing in more actors that are hostile to Israel. Those fears appeared to be borne out on Oct. 19, when the US military said one of its destroyers in the Red Sea had intercepted cruise missiles and drones launched toward Israel by Houthi rebels, who control Yemen’s capital and the surrounding area.

title: Jim Jordan Seeks Another House Speaker Vote Despite Fierce Opposition
description: Representative Jim Jordan tried to rally support for his bid to be House speaker early Friday despite entrenched opposition within his party, a group so riven by divisions that they have been unable to chose a leader for more than two weeks.

title: Record Breakers: Labour's By-Election Landslide
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Ukraine to Push Peace Formula at Meeting in Malta This Month
description: Ukraine will press forward with an effort to build support for a peace formula with the so-called Global South as Malta hosts a third gathering of senior officials to discuss the blueprint this month.

title: Meloni Breakup Removes a Political Liability for Italian Leader
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has announced her breakup with the father of her child, effectively ridding her of a political liability after he made a series of controversial remarks.

title: Argentina’s Dollar Craze Is About to Be Tested
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Americans are Worried About Paying Their Bills. That’s Helping Trump in Swing States
description: Voters in seven swing states are feeling the pain of rising prices for household essentials, according to a Bloomberg News and Morning Consult poll that points to trouble for President Joe Biden’s effort to make the economy a centerpiece of his bid for a second term.

title: Death Threats, Intimidation Mar Speaker Race in Age of Extremism
description: Death threats and political intimidation have erupted from the struggle to decide the US House speaker, highlighting how extremism and enmity in the American electorate are deepening the political divide in Washington.

title: Niger’s Ousted Leader Detained After Helicopter Escape Foiled, Junta Says
description: Niger’s ousted leader is being held in an undisclosed location after the nation’s junta said it had foiled an attempt by Mohamed Bazoum to escape his Niamey residence.

title: Saudi, UAE Leaders Hold Rare Talks as Israel-Hamas War Escalates
description: The leaders of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates met in Riyadh on Friday, indicating an effort by the two regional heavyweights to put differences to one side and confront the threat of the Israel-Hamas war becoming a wider conflict.

title: NATO Should Weigh Halting Russian Baltic Shipping, Latvia Says
description: NATO should consider a halt to Russian shipping in the Baltic Sea if evidence emerges that the Kremlin is behind the damage to a pipeline connecting Finland and Estonia, Latvia’s president said.

title: Xi Urges Vietnam to ‘Not Forget’ Roots of Its China Friendship
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged Vietnam not to forget the roots of the friendship between the two Communist countries during a meeting with Vietnamese President Vo Van Thuong in Beijing.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy, Biden Speak as US Leader Urges Funding
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy spoke with President Joe Biden on Thursday as the US leader made a rare Oval Office address to urge support for funding war efforts in Israel and Ukraine. Biden warned that Hamas and Russian President Vladimir Putin pose parallel threats to US democracy. Ukraine used US-provided ATACMS missiles for the first time this week to strike Russia-occupied airports on its territory.

title: Swiss Right-Wing Party Set to Cement Top Position in Election
description: A pedestrian walks past electoral posters on October 13, 2023 in Lausanne, ahead of the Swiss federal elections to elect a new Parliament. Switzerland's general election on October 22 is set to see the populist right make gains over European migration concerns and shatter Green dreams of getting into government. (Photo by Fabrice COFFRINI / AFP) (Photo by FABRICE COFFRINI/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Israel Latest: US Downs Missiles Targeting Israel From Yemen
description: The Pentagon said it’s experiencing an increase in drone attacks on US military bases in Iraq and Syria, while an American destroyer shot down cruise missiles and drones launched by Iran-backed Houthi militants in Yemen that were fired toward Israel.

title: Australia Confirms Chinese Firm’s Port Lease as Relations Thaw
description: Australia said that a Chinese firm can continue to lease the port of Darwin in the north of the country, the latest sign of the thaw in bilateral relations ahead of the expected visit to Beijing by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese.

title: UK’s Sunak Visits Egypt to Hold Talks on Israel-Hamas Conflict
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will travel to Egypt on Friday as he urges leaders in the Middle East to avoid regional escalation of the Israel-Hamas conflict.

title: Putin Visits Southern Army Headquarters After China Trip
description: President Vladimir Putin traveled to the headquarters of Russia’s Southern Military District near the border with Ukraine, following his return from talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in Beijing.

title: Starmer’s Labour Makes History, Takes Two Seats From Tories
description: The opposition Labour Party overturned huge Conservative majorities to win the parliamentary seats of Mid Bedfordshire and Tamworth, boosting leader Keir Starmer’s hopes of becoming prime minister in a UK vote expected next year.

title: India Pushes Back Against Russia Demands to Pay for Oil in Yuan
description: India is rejecting pressure from Russian oil suppliers to pay for crude imports in the Chinese currency as tensions between New Delhi and Beijing continue to simmer.

title: Trump Immunity Claim Slammed By Prosecutors in DC Election Case
description: US prosecutors pushed back on Donald Trump’s claim of absolute immunity against charges that he conspired to obstruct the 2020 election, saying that the former president, like other high-ranking government officials, “is not above the law.”

title: Russia Seeks Regular Security Talks With North Korea, China
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov called for regular trilateral security talks between North Korea, China and Russia to counteract what he characterized as a “dangerous policy” being pursued by the US, Japan and South Korea to tighten their joint defense posture in the region.

title: Biden Casts Russia, Hamas as Parallel Threats to Democracy
description: President Joe Biden directly appealed to the American people to support funding for Israel and Ukraine’s war efforts, warning that Hamas and Russian President Vladimir Putin pose parallel threats to US democracy.

title: China’s Stance on Hamas a Key Point of Division, US Envoy Says
description: The US’s top diplomat in China called on President Xi Jinping’s government to denounce terrorism by Hamas, citing Beijing’s stance toward the group as yet another challenge in fraught ties between the world’s biggest economies.
